titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Mary Agnes Irvine (b. 1888) graduated from Bryn Mawr College in 1910. She was a mathematics teacher. During the First World War she was a canteen worker for the YMCA in France.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the papers of Mary Agnes Irvine. Much of the collection is made up of letters to her parents written while she was serving in France. There are also several letters to Irvine from acquaintances she made in France. In addition there are photographs and a series of scrapbooks, from her time in France and from a 1915 trip Irvine took to Canada and Alaska, that contain photographs, postcards, and memorabilia.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
